**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1762196563924879)

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
Admin invites member to the workspace.
The invited member is the approver.

As admin

1. Go to [staging.new.expensify.com](http://staging.new.expensify.com/)
2. Go to workspace chat
3. Create an expense in the workspace chat
4. Open the expense report
5. Click Submit
6. Click More > Change approver
7. Click Bypass approvers

## Expected Result:
Selected item has a background highlight

## Actual Result:
Missing background highlight in selected item

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] Optimized useShortMentionsList

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Background The `useShortMentionsList` hook is used in LiveMarkdown/Composer components to filter personal details for short mention suggestions (format @username). Currently, this hook processes potentially thousands of user records to determine which users share the same private email domain as the current user. The hook calls areEmailsFromSamePrivateDomain() for each personal detail record, which internally performs domain extraction using Str.extractEmailDomain() twice per call - once for the current user’s email and once for each personal detail email. For accounts with large user bases, this results in thousands of redundant string operations during each render cycle, as the current user’s domain is extracted and checked repeatedly for every comparison. ### Problem When user enters report or search screen, the mention list calculation blocks the main thread for several hundred milliseconds, which negatively impacts the performance of opening the report or navigating through bottom tabs. ### Solution Pre-extract the current user’s domain once per render cycle. - If the domain is public, skip all comparisons since no matches are possible. - If private, extract each personal detail’s domain once and compare it directly against the cached current user domain. On account with ~27k personal details, computation time of useShortMentionList drops from ~390 ms to ~160 ms.
